intro: Hoya anncajanoae, commonly known as the "Coral Hoya," is a species of epiphytic flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its thick, fleshy stems and waxy, ovate leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, star-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red in color. Hoya anncajanoae thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. It is prized for its ornamental value and relatively low maintenance requirements.
